questions.question_text:
The SH schema contains the PRODUCTS table with column PDT_NAME defined as VARCHAR2(10).
Which two blocks of code execute successfully when invoked by user SH? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
D: Associative arrays do not have constructors. 
https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/LNPLS/composites.htm#LNPLS00504

Selected Answer: AC
A. Doesn't work on 12C but works on 19C
B. TABLE has to be initialized
C. Works fine
D. PLS-00681: named association syntax is required
E. VARRAY has to be initialized
A, C is correct.
Choice D also worked fine, along with A and C.

comments.content: D is Wrong. PLS-00681: named association syntax is required

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
tested

Selected Answer: B
Sorry it is B, for table the all_tab_columns gets updated but for the view it does not.

Selected Answer: D
tested

Selected Answer: B
B, tested

Selected Answer: B
tested B
what is colcount? Does not run on my SQLDeveloper version 23 unless I remove that word?
No B, it will create the view with the column names that existed before

comments.content: if you create the view and add colum, and if you execute this query return four records

discussion.content: Answer is A?

choices.C: It will result in an error because table depts has been altered.
choices.D: It will run successfully producing a result of 5.
choices.A: DEP_VU must be manually recompiled to successfully run this code.
choices.B: It will run successfully producing a result of 4.
There are no compilation warnings or errors.
choices.D: A performance compilation warning is generated.
choices.E: An information compilation warning is generated.
choices.C: A severe compilation warning is generated.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
The PLW-06002: Unreachable code warning is an informational compilation warning, not a performance-related warning. It alerts the developer that there is code in the program that will never be executed due to the control flow, but it does not impact the performance of the compiled code.

Selected Answer: E
6000-6249 for informational

Selected Answer: BDE
G is wrong. The question clearly asks for processing a multi-row query. Close doesn't process any query duh!

questions.question_text: Which three statements can process a dynamic multi-row query? (Choose three.)

In one of your databases, table HR.EMPLOYEES includes the columns FIRST_NAME and EMPLOYEE_ID.
A row exists with EMPLOYEE_ID 201.
Examine these packages created by user HR:
//IMG//

EXECUTE privilege is granted to user SH, on the HR.API and HR.HELPER packages.
Which two will execute successfully? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Correct answer is C,D

Selected Answer: CD
I think C,D is the Correct answer

Selected Answer: CD
CD y es correct

Correct answer is C,D. because the user cannot call proctected procedure directly https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/lnpls/ACCESSIBLE-BY-clause.html#GUID-9720619C-9862-4123-96E7-3E85F240FF36

choices.E: Create and call a package procedure API.H1 in the SH schema, which calls HR.HELPER.H1.
choices.C: Call HR.API.P1 from the HR schema.
choices.B: Call HR.HELPER.H1 from the SH schema.
choices.D: Call HR.API.P1 from the SH schema.
choices.A: Call HR.HELPER.H1 from the HR schema.
